title: A Designer Puts His Heritage Into Gold and Gems
description: Giorgio Bulgari, whose family founded the Italian jewelry line, is developing his own Giorgio B brand.

title: A Curator on the History and Mystery of Jewelry
description: Helen Molesworth, the senior jewelry curator at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, talks about her gem-driven travels and her new book.

title: Madonna and Flavor Flav Hit New York Fashion Week
description: Inside Off-White’s bash in SoHo; Graydon Carter’s love letter to Italy; and an early 2000s throwback with TV on the Radio.

title: Happy Birthday, Dear Frozen Eggs, Happy Birthday to You
description: Egg showers have become common on social media, but a Brooklyn woman has gone a step further by throwing her eggs a birthday party every year.

title: The Rise of the Husband
description: Much has been made of a new masculinity in this election cycle, but the biggest public transformation for men might be the role of the husband.

title: Buscaba a mi madre en todas las personas equivocadas
description: Cuando ella murió, mi padre se llevó su cuerpo a Pakistán. Al crecer, enfrenté la ausencia de mi madre con relaciones desastrosas.

title: A 120-Ring Collection That Reflects History
description: The pieces scheduled for a selling exhibition in London this fall range in origin, from ancient Greece to 18th-century Britain.

title: Inside the Great Gap Glow-Up
description: Can Zac Posen, known for over-the-top glamour, reinvent the American mall brand — and change his reputation in the process?

title: The Jewelry Vibe Is Decidedly Victorian
description: After years of Art Deco dominance, pieces with symbols such as flowers, insects, swallows, serpents and crescent moons have come into favor.

title: Before Debate, Donald Trump Mocks Kamala Harris’s Height
description: Kamala Harris is modest in stature, but is considered by some to have Tall Energy. Donald Trump has insisted she shouldn’t be allowed to use “boxes or artificial lifts” during the debate.

title: Meet Max Alexander, an 8-Year-Old Charming the Fashion World
description: An interest in design and a knack for sewing have earned Max Alexander celebrity fans and millions of social media followers.

title: Apple Picking Tips From Brian Frange of Apple Ratings
description: Brian Frange has been pontificating on apples since 2016. He has a few things to say before you hit the orchards.

title: Sweden’s Toteme Has a Fan Base at New York Fashion Week
description: The Stockholm fashion label Toteme has a no-nonsense, “pragmatic” look — and a lot of fans in New York.

title: Susan Lucci’s Dramatic Return to the Runway at NYFW
description: Susan Lucci hits the catwalk for the first time since she took a memorable tumble. Plus: giant Loewe vegetables, poufy dresses and browsing for backpacks.

title: Off-White Comes to New York: NYFW Review
description: Off-White celebrates the allure of the melting pot.

title: Givenchy Appoints Sarah Burton as Creative Director
description: The British designer will be the second woman to oversee collections for the 72-year-old French brand.

title: What Do You Believe In?
description: We want to hear from you — whether you’re religious or not.

title: Tory Burch, Rachel Scott, and the Female Fashion Figures Making Waves
description: Tory Burch plays to win, and Rachel Scott of Diotima has a star-making show.

title: How to Design a Cozy Window Seat
description: The best ones have several things in common, according to the pros. Here’s how to design yours.

title: Should I Keep or Sell My Designer Clothes?
description: A reader wonders what she should do with the high-end garments that stay in her closet year round. Our fashion critic explains her options.

title: US Open’s $100 Chicken Nuggets Cause a Stir
description: The tennis tournament is known for upscale offerings, but a new box of six “golden” nuggets drew a covetous crowd, and plenty of attention online.

title: US Open After Party Celebrates Buzzy Tournament
description: Celebrities like Issa Rae and Nicky Hilton Rothschild, and former tennis stars like Maria Sharapova and James Blake, helped close out the tournament in style.

title: In Shanghai, Searching for Those in Search of Connection
description: Every week, lonely retirees in the city gather in a public park — and an Ikea canteen — with one goal in mind: finding true love. Alexandra Stevenson shared their stories.

title: Ib Kamara on Taking Over Off-White After Virgil Abloh
description: Ibrahim Kamara on Mr. Abloh’s fashion legacy and bringing the brand he built to New York Fashion Week.

title: Lloyd Ziff, Visionary Photographer and Art Director, Dies at 81
description: He designed some of the most visually exciting magazines of the 1970s and ’80s. But his real love, and eventually his focus, was photography.

title: Night of the Supermodels in New York, Guest Appearance by Rihanna
description: What happened when Pieter Mulier brought the Alaïa show to the Guggenheim.

title: The Great American Family Car Ride
description: Three bridges, one toll.

title: During NYFW, Jill Biden, Anna Wintour and More March for Voting Awareness
description: Jill Biden, Anna Wintour and top American designers participated in a voting awareness march at the onset of New York Fashion Week.

title: Yankees and New York or Nowhere Release Streetwear Collection
description: A lifestyle brand known for its declarations of N.Y.C. supremacy joins forces with baseball’s winningest franchise.

title: What’s the NaNoWriMo Drama With A.I.?
description: An online writing community was set aflame this week after National Novel Writing Month, or NaNoWriMo, said it wouldn’t take a stance on the use of A.I.

title: How Ralph Lauren Got Jill Biden to the Hamptons
description: The designer held a show on Long Island and built a dream world as a backdrop.

title: Taylor Frankie Paul and the Story Behind ‘The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives’
description: A new Hulu series will explore a cheating scandal — and its aftermath — that rocked the world of Mormon social media influencers.

title: In Tracy Schorn’s World, Getting Cheated On Makes You a ‘Chump’
description: And if you’re the side piece, you’re a “schmoopie.” Welcome to Tracy Schorn’s one-of-a-kind vision of infidelity.

title: An Artistic Collaboration Offers Miniature Dinosaur Pendants
description: Miniature versions of three big lizards have been turned into limited-edition pendants by the artist Jake Chapman and the jeweler William Welstead.

title: He Quit His Job and Bought a Trailer for a Nomadic Life
description: The customized home has a propane range, an incinerating toilet and movable solar panels (for off-the-grid travel). Now the only question is where to go next.

title: Maria Bello: Touching My First Time for the Last Time
description: He couldn’t speak or move, but the sexual energy between us was still palpable.

title: On a Quest For a Simpler Life, Two Backpackers Find Romance
description: As backpackers who met in Australia in 2017, Ryan Hawkins wrote to Naina Rishiraj: “One day I hope we can be in the same place for a long time.” His hope came true.

title: Like Jay Gatsby, He Threw Parties to Get Her Attention. It Finally Worked.
description: After Andrew Quintero spotted Sophia Babai on Instagram in 2016, it took four years and the help of a mutual friend to finally meet her in person.

title: Two Souls in the Same Orbit Finally Collide
description: Kimberly Stokes and Dexter Mason were connected in several ways as adolescents, but didn’t connect until college and, later, an auto event.

title: A Courtship Filled with Dijon Chicken and Love Notes
description: Molly Shoemaker and Cody Wymore met at a community theater in 2018. He impressed her by bringing in home-cooked meals.

title: Tareasa Johnson, Who Went Viral on TikTok as Reesa Teesa, Is Getting a TV Show
description: Tareasa Johnson captivated millions on social media with a multipart story about her ex-husband’s lies. Now, it’s slated to become a TV show.

title: Michigan Reveals Winning ‘I Voted’ Sticker Design Following Competition
description: A contest for the state’s next “I Voted” sticker yielded several winning designs, but a seventh grader’s stood out from the rest.

title: Venice Film Festival Looks: Nicole Kidman, Daniel Craig and More
description: The event, held not long after the couture shows in Paris, has been a showcase for new designs as well as vintage pieces.

title: What’s the Best Wedding Favor? A New Spin on the Gift-Giving Custom.
description: A growing number of couples are including gifting suites that allow their wedding attendees to pick a souvenir they’ll actually use.

title: Haider Ackermann Named Creative Director of Tom Ford
description: Haider Ackermann, a coolly sensual designer, is the new creative director at Tom Ford.

title: Lisa Taddeo’s Book ‘Three Women’ Is Now a Starz Series. She Feels Just OK About It.
description: A writer’s success today may be measured in film and television adaptations. Lisa Taddeo, whose book “Three Women” is now a Starz series, hates that.

title: Luca Guadagnino Has a Film at the Venice Film Festival and Curates Homo Faber
description: The film director and designer did double duty in Venice, Italy, debuting a film at the Venice Film Festival along with his curation of Homo Faber, the craftsmanship exhibition.

title: Our Granddaughter’s Boyfriend Is Too Old for Her. What Can We Do?
description: A reader and her husband are united in disapproval of the 14-year age gap in their granddaughter’s relationship. What they don’t agree on is whether to invite him to dinner.

title: What You Need to Know About Fashion Month
description: Also, everything else you need to know about what’s happening this fashion month.

title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘A Drunk Dial Followed by Sporadic G-Chats ’
description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

title: Jack Robbins Lampoons Nepo Baby Culture With His Parents’ Help
description: In a series of videos, Jack Robbins has been lampooning nepo baby culture — and embracing it — with help from his parents and Steven Spielberg’s daughter.
